name: 5-chloro-2-methoxy-4-methylbenzenesulfonyl chloride
Reason: 5-chloro-2-methoxy-4-methylbenzenesulfonyl chloride has a melting point that we will analyze by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is 2-methoxybenzene, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. (2) The chlorine atom introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. (3) The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. (4) The sulfonyl group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, estimated at around +30 degrees Celsius. (5) The methyl group introduces a small increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius.
